rubrics.requirements: Browser Automation Engine - Core system that controls web browsers through standardized protocols

sub_tasks.requirements: Multi-Protocol Communication Layer - Manages bidirectional communication with browsers via CDP and WebDriver BiDi
Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) Implementation - Primary protocol for Chromium-based browser control
CDP Session Management - Creates, manages, and terminates CDP sessions for isolated browser contexts
WebSocket Transport Layer - Handles real-time bidirectional communication with browser processes
Protocol Message Serialization - Converts JavaScript commands to protocol messages and responses back
Auto-generated CDP Type Bindings - Provides type-safe interfaces for CDP commands and events
WebDriver BiDi Implementation - Cross-browser compatibility layer for Firefox and other browsers
Capability Negotiation & Protocol Fallback - Determines browser capabilities and falls back to compatible protocols
Command Mapping & Response Normalization - Translates between WebDriver BiDi and internal command formats
Extension Transport for In-Browser Puppeteer - Enables browser extension-based automation
Content-Script Message Relay - Facilitates communication between extension and page contexts
Browser Lifecycle Management - Controls browser process creation, configuration, and termination
Browser Launcher & Process Manager - Spawns and monitors browser processes
Executable Path Resolution - Locates and validates browser binaries across different platforms
Launch Arguments Configuration - Applies browser-specific flags, sandbox settings, GPU options, and headless mode
Process Health Monitoring - Tracks browser process state, handles unexpected terminations, and manages zombie processes
User Data Directory Orchestration - Manages profile isolation and cleanup scheduling
Browser Binary Management - Handles download, installation, and caching of browser executables
Multi-Platform Binary Distribution - Supports fetching browser versions across different platforms and release channels
Incremental Download with Progress Tracking - Manages browser binary downloads with progress hooks and caching
Version Resolution & Cache Management - Provides CLI and programmatic APIs for browser version management
Browser Context Isolation - Creates sandboxed environments for independent automation sessions
Incognito Context Management - Provides isolated browsing sessions with separate cookies, storage, and permissions
Permission and Security Policy Control - Manages browser permissions and security settings per context

rubrics.requirements: Hierarchical Object Model - Provides structured abstraction layers for browser automation

sub_tasks.requirements: Browser Object - Top-level interface managing browser instances and global settings
Browser Context Management - Manages collection of BrowserContexts including default context
Global Browser Operations - Provides methods for page creation, browser termination, and instance-wide settings
Page & Frame Tree Abstraction - Represents hierarchical page structure and navigation states
Page Object - Primary interface for automating browser tabs with frame hierarchy management
Frame Object - Scoped execution context for main documents and iframes
Frame Tree Navigation - Traverses and manages hierarchical frame structures with cross-frame communication
Frame Context Isolation - Ensures actions are targeted correctly within complex page structures
Handle Object System - Remote references to browser-resident objects with lifecycle management
JSHandle - Generic handle to JavaScript objects in browser with garbage collection tracking
Remote Object Reference Counter - Manages memory references and prevents leaks
Detached Frame Invalidation - Handles reference cleanup when frames are destroyed
ElementHandle - Specialized JSHandle for DOM elements with direct interaction capabilities
Element Property Access - Retrieves attributes, properties, computed styles, and state information
Element Interaction Methods - Provides click, type, screenshot, and other element-specific operations
Navigation Controller - Manages page transitions, loading states, and browser history
Navigation Lifecycle State Machine - Tracks and manages page loading progression
Network Idle & DOMContentLoaded Detection - Identifies when pages reach specific loading milestones
Navigation Timeout Management - Handles timeouts for slow-loading pages and network conditions
History Stack Synchronization - Controls browser back/forward navigation and state management
Page State Retrieval - Accesses current page URL, title, and HTML content
Content Querying and Element Selection - Locates and references DOM elements using various strategies
Multi-Engine Selector System - Supports CSS, XPath, ARIA, text, and pierce selectors
CSS & XPath Selector Backends - Standard CSS and XPath expression evaluation
Extended Query Engines - Text-based, ARIA accessibility, and shadow DOM piercing selectors
Custom Query Handler Registry - Plugin system for domain-specific element selection strategies
Locator API with Retry Semantics - Robust, auto-waiting, chainable element queries
Auto-Retry Element Queries - Automatically re-queries elements on action until timeout
Condition Waiting Framework - Polls DOM until elements matching selectors appear or conditions are met

rubrics.requirements: User Interaction Simulation - Emulates human-like interactions with comprehensive input device support

sub_tasks.requirements: Action Dispatcher with Input Replay - Coordinates complex interaction sequences
High-Level Element Interactions - Click, hover, tap, type, select, and drag-and-drop operations
Hit-Test & Clickable Point Calculator - Determines optimal interaction points on elements
Element State Monitoring - Verifies visibility, position, and interaction readiness before actions
Low-Level Input Device Control - Fine-grained keyboard, mouse, and touch event synthesis
Keyboard Input System - Generates key events with proper timing, modifiers, and IME support
Mouse Interaction Engine - Simulates mouse movements, clicks, wheel events, and drag operations
Touch Interface Support - Provides touch gesture simulation for mobile testing
Form Interaction Framework - Specialized handling of form elements and file operations
File Upload Simulation - Manages file selection and upload with blob-to-protocol encoding
Dialog Management - Handles browser alerts, confirms, prompts, and file chooser events

rubrics.requirements: JavaScript Execution and Object Marshalling - Enables code execution within browser contexts

sub_tasks.requirements: Script Injection System - Executes JavaScript code in page or isolated execution contexts
Runtime Function Call Builder - Constructs and executes Runtime.callFunctionOn commands
Argument Serialization System - Handles JSHandle, ElementHandle, bigint, Date, RegExp conversion
Exception & Stack Trace Rewriting - Captures, parses, and reports JavaScript execution errors
Execution Context Registry - Manages isolated worlds and script injection per frame
Isolated World Injection - Separates automation scripts from page scripts to prevent interference
Preload Script Management - Stores and re-injects scripts on navigation events
Cross-Context Communication Bridge - Allows Node.js functions to be called from browser context
Function Exposure Framework - Injects Node.js functions into browser's window object
Callback Registry with Promise Adapter - Manages async function calls between contexts
Parameter Marshalling - Handles data type conversion between Node.js and browser contexts

rubrics.requirements: Network Interception and Observability - Monitors and controls network traffic with comprehensive proxy capabilities

sub_tasks.requirements: Request/Response Proxy Chain - Intercepts and modifies network traffic
Cooperative Intercept Mode - Manages multiple interceptors with priority queue system
Request Action Resolution - Processes abort, continue, and respond actions on intercepted requests
Header and Payload Mutation - Provides buffers for modifying request data and headers
Response Mocking System - Provides custom responses without hitting actual servers
Network Environment Control - Manages cookies, authentication, and network conditions
Cookie Jar Synchronization - Manages partition-aware cookie storage with same-site enforcement
Network Condition Emulation - Simulates bandwidth throttling, offline mode, and connection states
Authentication & Header Management - Controls extra HTTP headers and auth credentials
Security Details & Certificate Validation - Provides SSL certificate information and validation

rubrics.requirements: Content Capture and Analysis Pipeline - Extracts and processes web page content in multiple formats

sub_tasks.requirements: Visual Content Capture - Generates screenshots and visual representations
Screenshot Composer - Multi-strategy image capture system
Capture Strategy Engine - Supports viewport, full-page, element-specific, and clipped screenshots
Image Format Encoder - Outputs PNG, JPEG, and WebP formats with quality control
PDF Generation System - Converts web pages to formatted PDF documents
Print Media Emulation - Applies print-specific CSS styles and layouts
Layout Control System - Manages margins, headers, footers, page breaks, and formatting options
Performance and Coverage Analysis - Collects runtime metrics and code usage data
Performance Trace Collection - Gathers browser performance data and timing information
Navigation Timing Analysis - Measures page load performance characteristics
Performance Trace JSON Exporter - Formats and exports trace data for analysis
Code Coverage Analysis - Tracks JavaScript and CSS usage during execution
Coverage Range Merger - Combines CSS & JS coverage data with unused code identification
Accessibility Tree Capture - Extracts page accessibility information for automated testing
Screen-Cast Recording - Provides video recording capabilities for session capture

rubrics.requirements: Environment Emulation and Configuration - Simulates devices, conditions, and manages system configuration

sub_tasks.requirements: Device and Environment Emulation - Mimics various devices and user conditions
Device Emulation Framework - Simulates hardware and software characteristics
Viewport and Display Configuration - Sets dimensions, device pixel ratios, and scaling factors
Device Preset System - Provides pre-configured device profiles (iPhone, Android, etc.)
User Agent and Hardware Emulation - Modifies browser identification and hardware capabilities
Environmental Condition Simulation - Emulates system states and user preferences
Media Feature Emulation - Simulates CSS media queries, color schemes, and motion preferences
Geolocation and Timezone Mocking - Provides fake GPS coordinates and regional settings
CPU Throttling - Simulates performance on slower devices
Configuration Management System - Handles system-wide settings and extensibility
Launch Options Normalization - Processes and validates browser launch configurations
Environment Variable & Config File Resolution - Manages project-wide settings through files and environment
Plugin Registry for Extension - Enables custom query handlers and system extensions

rubrics.requirements: Event System and Synchronization Framework - Manages event-driven interactions and asynchronous operations

sub_tasks.requirements: Event Emission and Broadcasting - Observable events for browser and page state changes
Lifecycle Event Management - Emits events for page lifecycle moments (load, domcontentloaded, navigation)
Network Event Tracking - Reports request, response, and failure events for real-time monitoring
Browser Interaction Events - Broadcasts console messages, dialogs, errors, and worker creation events
Waiting and Synchronization System - Provides timing control and state synchronization mechanisms
Condition Waiting Framework - Waits for specific page states, elements, or custom conditions
Element Condition Waiting - Waits for element visibility, presence, and interaction readiness
Function-based Waiting - Waits for custom JavaScript conditions to be satisfied
Network Idle Detection - Waits for network activity to cease before proceeding
Timeout Management System - Handles operation timeouts and prevents infinite waiting
Global and Operation-Specific Timeouts - Configures default and custom timeouts for various actions

rubrics.requirements: Observability and Diagnostics Infrastructure - Provides monitoring, logging, and debugging capabilities

sub_tasks.requirements: Protocol Traffic Monitoring - Logs and tracks communication with browser instances
Pending Call Tracker - Monitors outstanding operations for hang detection and debugging
Console Message & Dialog Forwarding - Relays browser console output and dialog events to automation context
